intro: Bichea nitida, commonly known as the silverleaf bichea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety, silver-green leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Bichea nitida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and attractive blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
